availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Cornelius G. Bradshaw (Douglas County, Illinois, chaplain (U.S.A.))

body.p: Douglas County, Illinois, chaplain (U.S.A.). Kentucky native. Married to Sarah Bradshaw. Father of Cornelia Bradshaw. Resident in Piatt County, Illinois, in 1860. Resident of Douglas County, Illinois in 1862. Served in the 79th Illinois Volunteer Infantry as Chaplain from August 28, 1862, to September 11, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Illinois, vol. 5 (Springfield: Phillips Brothers State Printers, 1901), 28.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Illinois, Piatt, Willow Branch, p. 6.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Illinois, McLean, Normal, p. 559A.
Washington, D.C., Wills and Probate Records, Box 296 (accessed via ancestry.com on May 29, 2019).
